title: Watch: Patriots’ Super Bowl LX send-off rally
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: The Patriots' Super Bowl LX send-off rally was held at Gillette Stadium with appearances by Robert Kraft and Mike Vrabel.
The rally featured a performance by the Dropkick Murphys, and team captains addressed the crowd before departing for California.
Super Bowl LX between the Patriots and Seahawks is on Feb. 8 at Levi's Stadium; Seattle is favored by 4.5 points.

title: Carlton Davis gives his pitch for free agents to join Patriots this offseason
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Carlton Davis praises Patriots' culture and head coach Mike Vrabel, urging free agents to join the team.
Patriots are playing in the Super Bowl with significant salary cap space for the upcoming season.
Top free agents include George Pickens, Trey Hendrickson, and Jaelan Phillips; Patriots previously showed interest in Phillips.

title: Where does Milton Williams rank among Patriots’ 10 best free-agent signings ever?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Milton Williams has logged 5.5 sacks this postseason and regular season, proving a valuable Patriots signing.
Williams signed a four-year, $104 million contract with $63 million guaranteed, making him the highest-paid in Patriots history.
Despite missing five games, Williams ranks eighth in defensive tackle pass rush win rate, showing season-long impact.

title: 8 lesser discussed potential trade deadline candidates that could make sense for Celtics
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Celtics aim to add players without major trades ahead of the NBA trade deadline.
Potential candidates for Celtics include Nets' Nic Claxton and Mavericks' Daniel Gafford.
Celtics must consider luxury tax implications when trading for players like Gafford or Jackson.

title: Something in the Way Fest 2026: Live updates from Roadrunner
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: The second annual Something in the Way festival featured two dozen indie and alternative rock bands at Boston's Roadrunner.
Explosions in the Sky's instrumental set provided a captivating and unexpected finale to the festival as the headlining act.
The Hotelier and Angel Du$t carried the festival's energy with engaging sets, showcasing loyalty and interactive crowd dynamics.

title: Why the Bruins practiced in a tent on Saturday in Florida
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Boston Bruins practiced in a tent at Raymond James Stadium to maintain ice quality before Sunday's outdoor game.
The tent, built by the NHL, is 34 feet high and includes air conditioning to protect the ice from Florida's humidity.
Temperatures are predicted to be in the 30s for the Stadium Series game, colder than previous outdoor NHL events in Tampa.

title: Boston ‘ICE Out Everywhere’ protest must-see moments
author: Annie Jonas and Samantha Genzer
bullets: Thousands gathered on Boston Common for the 'ICE Out Everywhere' protest, opposing local cooperation with ICE.
The protest was part of a nationwide campaign happening in over 300 cities, inspired by recent deaths in Minneapolis.
Organized by local advocacy groups, the event urged nonviolent resistance and sought stronger protections for immigrants.

title: Photos from Boston’s ‘ICE Out Everywhere’ protest
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Over a thousand people protested against Trump's immigration policies at Boston Common in 15-degree weather.
The 'ICE Out Everywhere' protest was organized by Mass 50501 and other local groups.
The protest is part of a nationwide series following the 'National Shutdown' on Friday.

title: Insider believes Red Sox have ‘another move in them’ this offseason to improve infield
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox may pursue another infielder before the 2026 season, prioritizing defense over power, says ESPN's Jeff Passan.
Red Sox linked to players like Isaac Paredes and Christian Walker, but team fit and needs remain uncertain.
Boston may consider Marcelo Mayer as full-time third baseman with Romy Gonzalez and David Hamilton at second base.

title: Even Drake Maye’s dad is surprised by Patriots’ Super Bowl run
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Drake Maye leads the Patriots to Super Bowl LX after a significant turnaround season, despite preseason doubts.
Maye's father, Mark Maye, expresses surprise at the Patriots' Super Bowl appearance, acknowledging some fortunate wins.
Drake Maye's family, including his brother Luke traveling from Japan, plans to attend Super Bowl LX in Santa Clara.
